subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In {{w|traditional Chinese}}, Japanese {{w|kyūjitai}}, Korean {{w|hanja}} and Vietnamese [[Nôm]], the component [[File:U26c29-ue0102.svg|25px|text-bottom|𦰩󠄂|link=𦰩]] for this character is written with {{l|mul|廿}} on top. Note that the bottom portion is written {{l|mul|口}} overlapped by {{l|mul|夫}} and not {{l|mul|中}} on top of {{l|mul|天}}. * In Japanese {{w|shinjitai}}, the component [[File:U26c29.svg|25px|text-bottom|𦰩|link=𦰩]] is written with [[艹#Translingual|艹]] on top and has one stroke less. Due to {{w|Han unification}}, both traditional Chinese and Japanese forms are encoded under the same [[code point]]. The appearance of this character will differ according to the font used. * In {{w|simplified Chinese}}, the component [[File:U26c29-ue0102.svg|25px|text-bottom|𦰩󠄂|link=𦰩]] is simplified to {{l|mul|又}} instead, giving the character {{l|mul|难}} (U+96BE). * Two {{w|CJK Compatibility Ideographs|compatibility ideographs}} exist for this character. U+FA68 corresponds to the {{w|kyūjitai}} form of this character while U+FAC7 corresponds to the alternative Korean form which is similar to Japanese shinjitai.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=172|rad=隹|as=11|asj+=10|sn=19|snj+=18|four=40514|canj=TOOG,TIOG|ids=⿰⿱廿⿻口夫隹(GHTKV,U+FA68),⿰𦰩隹(J,U+FAC7)}}

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*na-n/t||ill, pain, difficult, evil spirit}}.

Cognate with {{cog|bo|མནར||to suffer; suffering}}, {{m|bo|ན||to be sick, ill}}, {{m|bo|ནན་ཏེ||sick, ill}}, {{m|bo|ནད||disease, suffering}}, {{cog|my|နာ||to suffer pain, to be ill}}, {{m|my|နတ်||{{w|nat (spirit)}}, evil spirit}}.
